nodes.text: Paying a small sum of money to an official to speed up a process is known as a facilitation payment. We make no distinction between facilitation payments and bribes, no matter how small the amount. Facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.
It is unlikely to be a facilitation payment if it is an official, fixed and published fee and you will get a receipt.

However, there are legitimate fees for speeding up some services such as a fee to quickly process an application. Make the payment if it is an official transaction and it has been asked for in an open and transparent way.
Obtain a receipt detailing the reason for and the amount of the charge.
Record the transaction appropriately.
If you are in any doubt do not pay.

There is a risk that you are being asked to make an unauthorised payment.  Paying a small sum of money to an official as a fine can be a facilitation payment in disguise. No matter how small the amount, facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.  Even if not instigated by you, paying facilitation payments can seriously damage our reputation.

You should strongly resist any demand for this kind of payment. Remain calm and be prepared to wait.  Showing impatience can increase pressure to pay.  Say no and use the following to help you challenge the fee.
Remain courteous, respectful and if possible friendly
Ask to speak to the supervisor/manager of the person making the demand to discuss why you cant pay
State that you would need an official receipt if you were to pay the fine and guage the response.
Make it clear that your company does not allow you to make irregular, non-standard or unofficial payments of any kind
Ask for name and official title of person asking and any identity number
Mention that you will contact the embassy / consulate to discuss / report the issue
Explain that you must call your company first to report the issue and to get permission to pay the fee
Take notes or make mental note of the conversations and the time and place for a later report
Do you feel threatened in any way or are you being coerced into paying?
